Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller051
Reviews.Content: No disappointment here, staff first class, service excellent rooms spotless and served well, no real restaurant at the Hotel and the bar is not really to sit and have a night of it but who cares with the perfect location of this hotel surrounded by the finest restaurants bars and attractions Paris has to offer, We have stayed many hotels all over the world and the staff at this hotel are the best yet , will definitely go again and fully recommend, although given the choice do not opt for a view of the Tower the view isn’t that good and certainly not worth the extra you have to pay

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris Hotel Near Champs Elysee”
Reviews.Author: EnchantedOne
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful 5 day stay at the Hotel Balzac, a block off the Champs Elysee in Paris. Such a lovely boutique hotel with very pretty, comfortable rooms. My husband was on business and joined my 18 yo son and me for pleasure after work. The Concierge, Patrick, is a GEM of a person and resource. Always smiling and eager to help, Patrick found us amazing, HOT NEW restaurants to enjoy with our 18 yo son. Naomi, at the front desk is equally kind and helpful. There's a lovely breakfast each morning in a beautiful, quaint sitting room, where you may choose off the sumptuous buffet or from the menu. Everyone is so eager to help with a happy attitude. Lovely rooms for great rest and modern TVs. To find taxi's, either they will be phoned and appear within moments or you may walk down the block to Champs Elysee where taxis and Metro are right there. We loved this location for walking, Laduree and high end shops nearby, not to mention the beauty of L'Arc de Triomphe so close you may touch it. Spectacular at night. The hotel has wireless internet and the only reasons I did not give the Hotel an "Excellent" are: 1. the room internet did not work for 4 days (though the lobby & hallway wireless did work.) & 2. the evening we wanted dinner room service, only had 3 poor choices -- disappointing after an exhausting day. We absolutely will be returning to Hotel Balzac. Our trip was absolutely a joy in a large part to the great, relaxing accommodations and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarsbarUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed her with my husband recently and booked via Eurostar package. I had read previous reviews on this site and based my decision on those. The hotel is situated at the top of the Champs elysee very near to the Metro (Charles De Gaule) it took around 20 mins from the Eurostar (Gar Du Nord) and one metro change. We found the metro really easy to use very much like the London Underground. Ticket machines were available at the station, we got 10 at a time which was a little cheaper, I found out later that you can buy them on the Eurostar which would have saved us queuing time. 5 mins walk to the hotel it is situated up a side street and very quiet compared to the bustle of the main road, the reception is beautiful, very ornate decoration. There are plenty of staff about and our check in was quick and efficient, most of the staff speak good English. we booked a de-luxe room whichi had a huge bed, lovely bathroom with walk in shower (if you want a bath you must request when booking) TV channels etc were available but other than Sky news etc they were chargeable, we also paid 17e for Internet access for 4 days. Room service was avaliable but not sure who would pay those prices! It seemed a quiet hotel on the whole I think we were the only English people there, quite a few Americans though that was generally the case in Paris. We found all the staff to be extremely helpful especially the Conceigere Patrick who made all our dinner reservations and helped with directions, he was a mine of information and definitely is an asset to this hotel. Very easy to get around the main tourists attraction from here, we did a boat trip on the Bateaux Mouch to orientate ourselves which was a good idea this was only about 10/15 mins walk away. Couple of things I wish I had know before we went....eating out, tables can be a lot closer together than we are used to, a lot of restuarants close on Sunday/Monday although there are many Bistros open. Book your Effiel Tower tickets beforehand as the queus are huge, we gave up but when it is lit up at night it looks amazing so worth going down just to appreciate the shear size of it. Lots of buskers on the metro which was very entertaining. We ate at Chez Andre the first night, great atmosphere, friendly staff. best meal was L'Affriole (see my review) amazing food and value still can't quite believe what we paid! As part of our deal breakfast was included, it was lovely with loads of choice, fresh cheese,meats, pastries etc...although I see it would have cost 29e if we had paid so if you can get it included it's a good deal. In summary I would highly reccommend this lovely hotel to any couple looking for a bit of luxury in a quiet hotel but centrally located. Enjoy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful french boutique hotel 2 blocks from the Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: MedRepDad
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, quiet, hotel that was better than expected! We wanted a true french boutique style hotel that was quaint and near the action. This place is one block off the Champs Elysses and very convenient to a couple of Metro stops, shopping, overpriced restaurants, and much more! We really went blind into the hotel selection process blind and took a gamble on this place: completely worth it! Make the gamble!

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Lily18_9
Reviews.Content: Small romantic hotel with spirit of Paris. We book a clasic room for 290 euro per night and the room was great realy worth this money. When we came in room in 15min they was knocking on the door to ask are we satisfied whit room. Staff is great especially Mr. Patric really gentlman that know his job. This is our third time in Paris and best hotel till now. Only the breakfast is expensive we should take a room for 305euro whit breakfast this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel ! Lovely staff ! Great view from the bedroom !”
Reviews.Author: SouthamptonDrifter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after attempts to book a hotel room from a list of my friend's suggestions proved unsuccessful - they were either fully booked or just had a few horrendously priced rooms left. So, of course I referred to Tripadvisor, where Hotel Balzac was at or near the top of the league of fellow Tripadvisor's member's recommendations for hotels in Paris ! Nevertheless, it was with mild apprehension that we arrived at the hotel, having read the virtually guaranteed, occasional poor review of any widely visited hotel. Well, no complaints from us ! As we pulled up in the taxi, a porter was there immediately to help with the luggage.Close to the red carpeted exterior steps up to the entrance, there was even a lift to enable people experiencing mobility difficulties up to said entrance. Once inside, what struck me was the plushness of the decor and the availability of staff who were polite, pleasant and efficient, with English widely spoken.The porter and bar staff were helpful and fun, as were the concierge staff, with the reception staff being efficient and friendly. The bedroom was the real highlight though. Our room on the fourth floor had a great view of the Eiffel Tower; also because it was on a quiet street, the French Windows could be kept open by day OR night without significant noise or disturbance. The bed was large and comfortable, and the bathroom incorporated a bath-tub, high quality toiletries, and even a combined loo and bidet, complete with permanently heated seat ! The room was also spacious, decorated in a sophisticated and thoughtful manner, so that even the excellently placed, and large high quality television, was unobtrusive when not in use. There was also room service available 24 hours a day.A special thanks then to the room servicing/cleaning staff, who made the room attractive and spotlessly clean for us ! By the way, I had requested, on the hotel's website ,a room that was as peaceful as possible, with as good views as possible. That's exactly what we got ! The lounge bar was lavishly appointed with a magnificently draped set of curtains concealing a small dining area beyond where breakfast and a room service style daytime menu could be enjoyed. The lounge had a glass roof with the internal facing rooms therefore having an opportunity to people-spot those down below ! Another noticeable feature was the efficiency and timing of the service provided by the staff. The room service breakfast arrived bang-on our requested time, as did the taxi that the reception booked to take us back to Gare du Nord station. The staff also told us that the hotel was a "four and a half star" rating, and they were waiting for news on whether or not they would soon achieve a 5 star rating. Good luck in that quest ! A great hotel with the lovely staff contributing towards a memorable stay. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel For Customer Service and Ambience”
Reviews.Author: AustinKim_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at Hotel Balzac. The location of the Hotel could not be beat!! The room was very spacious and charming, and included a view of the Eiffel Tower. Front desk staff friendly and helpful, bartender a charmer and very knowledgeable of the city, but the concierge were outstanding!!! Professional and accommodating, they arranged a private car for a tour of the city, a romantic dinner under the beautiful Eiffel Tower, excellent recommendations for lunch and dinner and a semi private trip out to Versailles! Every request was accommodated......will definitely be back to Hotel Balzac!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our anniversary and stayed two nights. We booked a deluxe room, which for Paris, given the quality of the hotel, was reasonable in price. The room was very clean and comfortable and had more than enough space, including a queen size bed, desk, chairs and flat screen TV. The bathroom included a stall shower and a deep jetted tub. The bathroom was all marble. We were on the sixth floor (Room 601) and had a good view of the Eiffel Tower. The staff was very nice and helpful. We needed a last minute dinner reservation on Saturday when we arrived and they spent some time calling around to find us a good place. The hotel is located just off the Champs-Elysee near the Arc d'Triumphe, which is along the Metro 1 (yellow line), so it was easy to take public transportation from the hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place”
Reviews.Author: Sissi2702
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for business and stayed one night at the Balzac. Charming little hotel, great location. Staff was very pleasant and helpfull, check in and check out very efficient. Room was very nice and comfortable, great size for a Paris hotel. Nice bathroom, with a "high tech" toilet, one of those which heats, cleans, etc. a bit exaggerated, but.... Also, breakfast, which is not included, is a bit disapointing on the variety. Overall, nice place, I recommend it and would be a pleasure to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel, right in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: snowman40
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris on business for a few nights and the hotels were all busy so I ended up at the better than usual grade Balzac. The room I was booked into was described as a single and I had visions of a tiny cupboard with a bed barely big enough to lie in. Fortunately, this was far from the case. The room had a view onto the central void of the hotel (2nd floor) which let in plenty of natural light. The bed was more like a single and a half (two could sleep in it, but you'd want to be on good terms!) and there was a compact, but well appointed shower room/toilet. The main room had plenty of space, including a desk you could sit at in a chair (not on the bed like some!) and there was a small anteroom with the wardrobe in. The general decor of the hotel was traditional, but light and of high quality. The whole feel of the Balzac, from the entrance to the rooms was of quiet luxury. The breakfasts were good and the serving staff friendly (I found the reception staff a little frosty, though). I'm not sure my company would choose such an expensive hotel for me again, but I'd happily stay at the Balzac anytime and if you want a centrally located hotel you can't go wrong as it's literally a stone's throw from the Champs Elysee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Balzac for 4 nights during our visit to Paris in September. We had 2 rooms for 2 adult travellers. This is my first review on TA. I loved the hotel so much that I felt compelled to write it. The hotel is amazing. We are well-travelled, and stay in hotels in our home city just for the fun of it, so have high expectations. This hotel exceeded all expectations. The service was impeccable. Stephanie at reception and Patrick at concierge were wonderful. But every staff member that we encountered, from the bartender to the room service delivery personnel, was professional, polite and proficient (pardon the unintended alliteration). We will unhesitatingly call this hotel home on all future visits to Paris. It is located 2 blocks from the Champs Elysses – the location can’t be beat! The rooms are wonderfully Parisian, with all attention to detail and immaculately maintained. We had a gorgeous view of the Eiffel Tower from our room. The bar and breakfast were fantastic. Exceptional hotel!! Book without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bgetze
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Balzac. A great hotel in a perfect location. You can walk most places. Patrick, the concierge, was wonderful with restaurants and reservations. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Should be top few hotels to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tzenSingapore
Reviews.Content: Just came back from holiday in Paris and stayed at the Hotel Balzac. 1. Location is excellent with George V Metro and Hop on Hop off bus very near hotel. (2 min) 2. Hotel package with American breakfast provides good value as some cost savings from having a simple lunch. 3. Concierge Patrick is incredibly warm, helpful and friendly and makes you feel very welcome. 4. Found cafe staff very helpful as we brought back a bottle of champagne and they got us an ice bucket with glasses although we didn't order any foood or drinks. 5. Three Michelin star restaraunt Pierre Gagnaire is a must try as food and service was awesome and would be one of the very best meals you will ever take. 6. Room size is reasonable by Paris standards. 7. Marble toilet is well stocked with all necessary toileteries, hairdryer etc 8. Any request for assistance is promptly handled. 9. Wifi works without any problems. 10. No road noise as hotel is on a quiet street off Champs Elysee. Overall hotel is highly recommended and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to modern spec”
Reviews.Author: QuincyPup
Reviews.Content: I travel a fair amount, mostly in Europe. Balzac is not up to modern standards in a number of areas: - Shower varies hot/cold - Internet extremely unreliable. Goes up and down routinely. - No drawers or other places to put clothes On the brighter side the staff were fairly friendly and Toto toilet seats are always enjoyable. The great shining star of Hotel Balzac though is Patrick. His recommendations were always spot on and his assistance in other areas invaluable. Despite other issues I'd be tempted to stay here next year simply to have Patrick as a resource.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: TravelSteve8
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent four nights at the Hotel Balzac in late May and had no complaints. Even though this was my 8th trip to Paris and know the city quite well I wanted a hotel in this part of Paris for a number of reasons. The location was great. And even though it's only one block from the Champs Elysee it was very quiet. You would never know you were in the middle of this busy city. And the hop on and off bus was just a block away as well. We had a deluxe room, and it looked just like the picture on the hotel web site. We found the hotel to be spotlessly clean, and the staff eager to assist whenever we needed them. And whilte we didn't have a view to speak of, as our room over looked the interior courtyard it was pleasant and nothing to complain about. We also found the breakfast, which was included in our room rate to be more than adequate. Some have complained that it was the same every day. But the offerings were many and with eggs cooked to order along with the buffett we enjoyed our breakfast in the well appointed and comfortable room. This is not a large hotel, but that's not what we wanted. It was totally Parisien - and lacking for nothing at all. Right outside the front door is a row of the bicycles that can be rented with a credit card. So you can just pick a bike and go. And while this is an upscale area, the Publix market just a block away on the Champs Elysee was great for quick and delicious food. There were many places to eat at reasonable prices all around the area. We didn't have dinner at the Italian restaurant on-site. The only thing that I found odd, was at night the bed wasn't turned down, but made up with the sheets tucked tightly underneath the mattress. Not a big deal. Overall, the location, room rate, staff and hotel ambiance were spot on and we couldn't have been more pleased. So book with confidence and enjoy your stay. We would gladly stay at the Balzac again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bellaRN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Balzac on a recent trip to Paris. I wanted to stay in a nice Parisian-style hotel...but without having to pay the amount at the Four Seasons. Hotel Balzac is beautiful- very elegantly decorated without being overly "done up". Staff was very helpful and friendly. We stayed in a Deluxe suite with a view of the Eiffel Tower....stunning. The view from our small terrace was romantic and well worth the extra money per night. The room and bathroom were both spacious and well-equipt (bathroom had an awesome toilet seat cover with built-in bidet!). There were macaroons and water waiting for us upon our arrival in the room. We ordered room service twice and received quick service. Breakfast was not included with the price of the room and we were quite disappointed at how expensive it was- 28 euro for a continental breakfast and 38 euro for an "American" breakfast. Now, I know that we Americans have a bad rap for eating a lot but who could eat 38 euros worth of breakfast??? Overall great place to stay. Very well situated to many "attractions". Food overpriced even for hotel standards. I suppose this is typical for Paris. Lastly, the only odd thing that happened was that on the last morning that we were there, I went to take a shower and reached for my face scrub and found a used bottle of French brand shampoo (specifically for oily hair) in our shower...weird. Didn't fall in love with the most romantic city in the world so we probably won't return, but that had nothing to do with Hotel Balzac. Nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in a splendid location. Book with confidence”
Reviews.Author: KitsGQ
Reviews.Content: I travel to Paris at least once a year, and this was by far one of the nicest hotel experiences I've had. The staff is very friendly and eager to help. The concierge was most helpful, and in particular Patrick recommended some amazing restaurants that one would not know about unless they were a local. The rooms were very clean and spacious. We were upgraded to a junior suite, as it was an anniversary vacation. Upon check-in, we were greated by a bottle of Evian and some macoorons in our room - a pleasant and nice personal touch with a welcome note included! The location can't be beat and it's literally steps from the Champs-Elysses. Room service was fast and efficient and serves up a wonderful club sandwich. The only critique, and a minor one at that, is that there is no hot food served after 11pm. But that's not all that bad considering there are a 101 late night restaurants to chose from outside the hotel. Francoise, the assitant manager, greeted my in the hallway and asked if the room temperature was to my liking. This was a pleasant surprise as I had called during the night to ask the heat to be put on, and Francoise took the time to proactively approach me and ensure all was well. I will definitely be staying here again. Worth every euro!

Reviews.Title: “High Class, superb and professional service, fantastic location, excellent”
Reviews.Author: beanie012
Reviews.Content: we stayed a this hotel for our wedding anniversary from the 18th May for 3 nights, the hotel was in a fantastic location, the service was superb and the opulent decor was very welcoming. The room was very well appointed and spacious, with the latest LCD T.V capable of transmitting all channels and languages, the bathroom was a very high standard and beautifully decorated as was the bedroom. An even more wonderful surprise was having only been in the room a few minutes we were greeted with our drinks from the bar, complimentary water and macaroons and our luggage. The view was unbelievable of the Eiffel Tower and the balcony a pleasant surprise, the bed was top class as was the service from all of the staff and food exemplary, We highly recommend this hotel to anyone couples and families, and we will definately be coming back for many times to come this really is the most well appointed top class hotel minutes from the world renown Champs Elysee, Merci Beacoup Hotel Balzac, from M et Mme Cutts, England.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with Parisien flair...wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: janine9499
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Hotel Balzac. First trip to Paris. Couldn't have made a better choice. Location was phenomenal! The center of Champs Elysees was about 20 paces from the front door. We were able to walk virtually everywhere...the Lourve, the Tower, Arc de Triomphe, and, of course, the local shoppping. The hotel was super clean, bed was comfortable, and staff was so kind and helpful. We only ate one breakfast at hotel because meals were exceptionally expensive. With countless cafe's in the vicinity - it was no big deal to go out for every meal. It was more fun trying different places anyway. We already plan on returning to Paris and will only stay at Hotel Balzac!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BryMan
Reviews.Content: Small Hotel remodelled since our last visit. Great location just off the Champs, pricey breakfast but good restaurant/bar just down the street at half the price. Excellent service, amazingly quiet given that it is less than 100 meters from the Champs Elysees. Comfortable rooms...all expected facilities (including toilets with heated seats and front/rear washers dryers !!Ggot to try that !). Not cheap but woth it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly yet Discreet”
Reviews.Author: surrealus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a corner that could easily be missed. Upon check-in, the staff practically whisper so as not to call attention to you. The room was tastefully done with a large bathroom, but small shower. Upon arrival, we received a lovely welcome note with macarons. The staff were very helpful both before and during our visit. Our rate included transport to the hotel from the airport and breakfast. The driver was very knowledgeable and the car luxurious. The breakfast was more than adequate, but the same everyday. Big bonus - restaurant Pierre Gagnaire is attached to the hotel! And of course, the location is fabulous - close to many touristic sites. Two negatives; first, the bar area is pretty dead. Depending on your perspective, this could be a plus because the hotel was very quiet. Second, there is no gym.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Kharrell
Reviews.Content: My 13 year-old daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Balzac for five nights as part of a long-planned daddy/daughter trip to Europe. We found it to be an excellent choice. The staff was very attentive, and helpful; the room was large and very attractice; and we loved the location. There is a metro stop (George V) on the 1 line which is a two-minute walk from the hotel. Denis, the concierge, arranged a couple of dinners for us at restaurants which wouldn't be too stuffy for my daughter. We particularly enjoyed being at Los Oombres, a roof-top restaurant just below the Eiffel Tower, when they turned the sparkling lights on at the tower at 9 p.m. Most of the restaurants on the Champs Elysees (200 feet from the hotel) in this area were touristy except the Publicis Drugstore, which is a very unique shop and features an excellent restaurant. My only disappointment was the lack of a fitness center and the closest fitness center charges 26 euros a day for a pass. However, I would certainly stay at the Balzac again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: MKOK
Reviews.Content: Good location, very central. Nice rooms, but a little lazy service. Seems a little sleepy. 3 * Michelin restaurant right next to hotel. Pierre Gagnier.

Reviews.Title: “probably the best hotel in paris!”
Reviews.Author: asconetta
Reviews.Content: very nice but pretty small hotel. staff is really friendly and helpful and this is special for paris. staff truly cares about you and is available at all times. we booked a room on top floor but when we arrived we got a room on the first floor. we had no view and room was far too small so we complained about it. hotel was full that night but from the next day on we got a fabulous and marvellous room on top floor, huge room, absolutely gorgeous and fantastic view on champs-elysees, eiffel tower, the roofs of paris, the whole city up to the banlieues. hotel restaurant is not in the hotel building but there is the pierre gagnaire michelin restaurant which must be great (we didn't try it). just over the street there is restaurant les enfants terribles. it is very good and all constructed with highly standard materials and hot design. really recommandable. we will definitely be coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest place to stay in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dan_123_123
Reviews.Content: Paris is a tricky city to find the right hotel. Hotel Balzac is located right off of the Champs Elysee which is great for shopping, sight seeing and to catch taxis. The Hotel staff is brilliant: friendly check in; great concierge; fast room service; and good maids to clean the rooms and offering turn down service at night. The room was spacious for 'Paris' standards. Lovely bed (good mattress, lots of pillows), flat screen TV, and a very modern bathroom. (The toilette had more automated buttons than my car! Heating toilette seat, BD front and back, dryer, music, etc the Bentley of toilettes). The hotel is part of the JJW Group, which also owns The Grand Wien in Vienna. They have really put in all the luxuries in this hotel - but the best part is the friendly and smiling staff, which makes you feel that you are in the best hotel Paris has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “So Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: PAI_DC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so overpriced. Room was large by Paris standard, but nothing special. The price outrageous (420 euros) for a so so room and then you have to pay separately for the internet (22 euros a day) and no breakfast included! A simple drink at the bar was 18 euros. They did not even provide water in the room for the outrageous price. I've stayed at other hotels in Paris and this has to be the most overpriced and least value for money. The value here was the concierge, who was wonderful - I believe his name is Patrick - a delight and always found great restaurants for dinner. My pet peeve in the room - no mirror at the vanity so you cannot see to dry your hair. The hair dryer would not even stay in the socket. Only one socket on the desk so you could not have computer plugged in and separately charge a telephone. Much to pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: DonnaBaker26
Reviews.Content: Hotel Balzac is tucked away on Rue de Balzac only a block from the Champs Elysses. The traffic on the main boulevard is hardly discernible from this very Parisian hotel, which is tucked away from the hustle and bustle on this neighborhood side street. The lobby is quite welcoming, and the reception staff and concierge are very helpful and friendly. Our room had an amazing view of the Eiffel Tower, which was even better at night when the lights flashed every hour. We were enthralled our first night there watching this beautiful sight. While our room was a little shabby around the edges (peeling wallpaper, slightly soiled carpet), it was quite comfortable and afforded us every luxury we needed. When we arrived, we were greeted with a chilled bottle of champagne and French macaroons in honor of our 25th wedding anniversary. It was such a pleasant little extra to have the hotel recognize our special celebration in Paris. The bathroom was elegantly decorated with marble and one of the most upscale bidet/toilets we've ever seen in our travels. And I absolutely loved the drape over our bed that included a crown accent. We definitely felt like royalty! Daily breakfast was included with our room, but we were a little disappointed that it was the same choice every day. The food was good and very fresh, but we would have preferred a variety. I must mention that we had a problem on our last day at the Hotel, and upon returning home I contacted the General Manager to let him know. Not only was he swift to respond to the situation, but he handled it professionally, courteously, and with the utmost of care. I cannot say enough about how impressed we were with his concern that we were happy with the outcome of our situation and he took care of us beyond our belief. I would highly recommend this hotel, not only for its Parisian feel and appeal, but for its staff and General Manager. They are the epitome of French hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasLaurabell
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in Paris right off the Champs-Élysées. We got a very large room on the 5th floor.The staff was very friendly. The hop on hop off bus was just a few blocks away. I would recommend it. Just stay away from the breakfast. Very expensive for a roll and coffee....$28 euros.

Reviews.Title: “We chose this as our honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkHotelhopper
Reviews.Content: Stayed in April for five nights for our honeymoon. Did extensive research before hand and chose the Balzac because it was relatively small and looked very luxurious. When we arrived we were upgarded to a junior suite - a nice and unexpected touch. The room was superb with bedroom, lounge and vast bathroom with a huge bath and walk in shower. Cakes and macaroons were waiting for us in the lounge (another nice touch). Unfortuantly the Junior Suite faced a quite noisy road, so we asked to be moved. The staff were excellent and moved us immediately to an inner courtyard room where we literally didn't hear a thing for our entire stay. Breakfast was included in our rate - it was superb with fresh ingredients. There were lots of pastries, cheeses, yogurts, meats. Additionally the chef would cook eggs to order (perfect omelettes and scrambled eggs) and there was also hot mini pancakes, american style bacon, and chicken breast with onions (sounds wierd but was delicious), The hotel is three minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and five minute walk to Metro. As it is located just off the Champs Elysee there are plenty of restaurants and shops around. The only downside is the prices. Minibar is circa £6 for a coke, £5 bag of crisps and two sandwiches from room service costs about £50 (yes! - £25 for a cheese sandwich!). Drinks in the bar start at arount £13. Also, internet and PPV TV was extortionately priced (and hotels costing a third of Balzac have these for free these days). I would return to this hotel, as the room was fab and the staff very attentive. Thank you Balzac for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The icing on the cake for our trip to Paris - a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaToast
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Paris and planned somewhat spontaneously as a long Labor Day weekend getaway of five nights in Paris. I chose Hotel Balzac due to positive reviews in numerous sources as well as it is an iPrefer hotel. Booked it via iPfefer and chose a pay by AMEX plan which guaranteed a room upgrade. As is customary when arriving from the U.S., we appeared at the hotel just before 11 a.m. and were happy to learn that our accommodations were available and that we had indeed been upgraded to a Junior Suite which was a generous size even by European standards. A tip from our Air France flight attendant that we followed - we took the AirFrance bus from CDG to the L'Etoille stop at Arc de Triomphe and walked the few blocks to the hotel. Cost was 15 euros each and it was fun to walk down the Champs Elysees. An immediate confirmation that we had arrived in Paris! The bus stops at all the CDG terminals and is not limited to AirFrance passengers. The similar cab fare is approx 60 euros. Our suite (303) had a living room, bedroom, walk-in closet and large modern bathroom with deep tub, separate glassed shower with rain shower head (and hand held) and ample lighting. The linens were the best - pressed and high quality that complimented the bed. Flat screen tvs in both rooms. Wi-fi also available and easy to use but not free. Great heavy doors and quality hardware in all fixtures. The A/C was so quiet that one could not hear it, but totally efficient. A thermostat in the living room and one is the bedroom. Same with any plumbing sounds - heard nothing. Nor did we hear people or street sounds. Clean and well-managed by the housekeeping staff. The hotel is one block off the busy Champs Elysees and in a totally cool area. The world's largest Louis Vuitton store is just across the Champs Elysees and a walk to the Seine can be accomplished in 15 minutes by strolling down Avenue Georges V past the Four Seasons. Hotel Balzac is in the RIGHT place. The staff was totally pleasant (a fact we find throughout Paris) and Patrick, the one of the concierges was most helpful and fun. We'd booked restaurants via email with him prior to leaving the U.S.. We ate breakfast there daily as well as had a cocktail in the small bar one evening. A super hotel experience for us which made the short break memorable in the right way. We've stayed in many unique hotels across Europe (Dylan in Amsterdam, Ca Marie Adele in Venice, etc) and this ranks high on our list and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: love2travel60745
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights at the Balzac Hotel in Paris and loved it! Our room had olde worlde sophistication, however the bathroom was very modern and new. The bed was so lush... the type of bedding you want to take home. The manager and staff were very helpful and courteous- we needed an electric convertor in the middle of the night and one was delivered to our room, no charge. The Balzac was a block or so from the Champs Elysees but itself sat on a quiet street. We went everywhere ( St. Germain, Mont Marte, the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower etc...) and found that the hotel was very conveniently located. I will definitely stay at the Balzac again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TERRI SCHWARTZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights - June 1-4th. It was 400 euros/night. We stayed in room 408 - it was very beautiful. The king bed was especially comfortable and the room was large. The bathroom was large with both a tub and stall shower with a rainfall overhead shower head. The bathroom had Carven toiletries. We arrived earlier than check in from the US and our room was not available. In fact it was not available 1 minute before the 2:00 check in time. The weather was terrible - raining and cold. After leaving the hotel (we knew we were too early) and taking the hop on hop off bus tour for several hours we came back to the hotel - the room was still not ready. It took management quite a while to offer us a cup of tea. At a high class hotel I expected a little more customer service. The location of this hotel is walking distance to the Arc de Arc de Triomphe and the largest Louis Vuitton store in the world. We walked up and down the Champs-Elysées. The hotel also charges for wireless internet which we found ridiculous as most other hotels in this price category no longer charge for this!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Romantic, Perfect Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Ariby_GM
Reviews.Content: I was looking for the perfect hotel in order to propose to my then girlfriend, and after spending hours looking on Google and this site I finally found Hotel Balzac and it looked perfect. I booked a deluxe room (I did request one with views of Tour Eiffel but these are subject to availability and sadly all of them had already been booked) for 5 nights and arranged a transfer from the train station to the hotel through the one of the hotel's concierge. From the moment we were met by the chauffeur up to the moment we checked out we couldn't stop smiling, the service was excellent, one of the best places we've been to by far, easily matching and sometimes exceeding many of the 5* hotels we've stayed at. The hotel itself is gorgeous, very clean, and our deluxe room was spacious and very well decorated, the bathroom was top spec, and the bed was very comfortable. Even though we didn't get one with views of Tour Eiffel our room did not disappoint! Location is excellent, you're literally 1 minute away from Champs-Élysées and the Arc de Triumph, as well as a metro station. I'd like to thank all the staff at Hotel Balzac, and in particular our concierge Patrick, who helped me make our engagement as perfect as it could be by recommending the restaurant, making a reservation at the last minute, getting flowers & champagne for our room, etc. etc. (which were complimentary btw, thanks Hotel Balzac!) This is one hotel which we'll definitely be staying at again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Spent 5 romantic days in Paris in a fantastic, wellcoming, cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: roi111
Reviews.Content: All in this old stylish hotel was wellcoming: the staff was friendly, allways with a smile on the face and very helpfull. The "superior" room was extra clean all the time, our towels were replaced twice a day, every little corner in the room and bath were taken care constantly. You can notice that the hotel is managed by someone who cares! The atmosphere is quiet and elegant, even so the hotel is very close to noisy Chams Elysees. In a minute you can find yourself in the middle of the crowd in the Champs, but once you get into the hotel its totaly different feeling. We enjoyed staying there and we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “expensive olde worlde near champs elysees”
Reviews.Author: heloiseandtom
Reviews.Content: The room was large and quiet by Paris standards, the room service menu is ridiculously expensive but you can always go out for breakfast. It was decorated in pretty florals and clean but personally I prefer less cluttered styles. Service was otherwise quite good, a minor maintenance problem was addressed quickly.The champs elysees area is a dull place to stay (it was partly a business trip). check in took a very long time and the doorman didn't offer to help with my bags until AFTER I'd carried them up a flight of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in the heart of Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: MariaTAthens
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a romantic, elegant, recently renovated, not overcrowded and loud hotel at the heart of Paris to spend 4 days with my husband and i found it! It was Hotel Balzac!!! Just steps from the Champs Élysées elegant, warm, confortable with the Parisian atmosphere all over the place. When we arrived we were welcomed kindly by all of the staff that was in the loby area! Everyone present was saying welcome to hotel Balzac! Was pleasently surprised from the perfumed candles that gave a lovely warm atmosphere. There was no queue to check in just a fabulous armchair in front of the reception desk that you can take your time and relax from the trip while making the arrangements for the room.The room was a superior room comfortable, cozy and very well decorated with attention to detail with a small balcony overlooking Champs-Élysées and a hint of the Eiffel Tower. The marble batroom was lavish and had a tub, a different shower area, bathrobes, many many towels, and an electric toilet that is more like a toy! Breakfast was ok at the cosy brakefast-bar patio area since this is a boutique hotel and it used to be a house so do not expect a large breakfast area but for me this was good. The true gem is the concierge service at this hotel, they are extremely polite, and make every wish of yours come true in an instant even if you decide at the last minute as we did! Only drawback was the price of the internet that was a bit expensive. Other than that the experience was fantastic, all the employees spoke great english(this is very important) and they managed to retain the cosy and elegant atmosphere in every inch of the hotel a thing you don't see very often! Would definately recomend this hotel to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: BrianW6
Reviews.Content: Absolutely an incredible experience...service was friendly...room was outstanding with a balcony overlooking the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel near Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: TsvetomiraP
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at Hotel Balzac. The rooms were nice and the staff was really welcoming. The location of the hotel is perfect because the Arc de Triomphe is near, the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower too. If I go to Paris again, I'd definitely stay at Balzac.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, comfortable, convenient...what more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: medorand
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a weekend trip to Paris for our anniversary and chose the Hotel Balzac for it's excellent location and good reputation. The price was better than some of the larger more famous luxury hotels, but I honestly can't think of what we would have gotten out of them that we didn't get at the Hotel Balzac. It is just two blocks from the Champs Elysees, the Arc d'Triomph, and a major subway line. The rooms are gorgeous, decorated tastefully in deep reds and plums. The bed was very comfortable and actually came as a single king sized mattress rather than 2 twin beds pushed together (as is usually the case in European hotels). The bathroom wasn't huge but it had all the amenities, including vanity mirrors, heated floor, even a sound system. My only complaint would be the silly shower. You had to hold the shower head in your hand...there was no place to attach it above. We didn't try the breakfast because it wasn't included and it was ridiculously priced, but I like to venture out so I don't count that as a negative thing. The concierge was very helpful scheduling reservations and taxis. I couldn't recommend the Hotel Balzac enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location in beautiful Paris”
Reviews.Author: GrantsintheGlen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days at the Hotel Balsac and had a marvelous time. The location is great - close to Metro, shopping and Arch de Triumph. Our room was spacious by Paris standards, and the bathroom was great - shower and tub. The best thing about the Hotel is the concierge - Patrick. Can't say enough about him. He was so helpful with all our requests, large and small - from restaurant reservations, museum tickets, rail tickets etc. to ensuring we had everything we needed to ensure our trip was perfect. All the staff were helpful, gracious and pleasant, but Patrick stood out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travellator10
Reviews.Content: When you go to Paris as a tourist, the importance of location cannot be highlighted enough. This hotel was a one minute walk from the Champs Elysees. The hotel has a quaint and cosy feel to it, the rooms are beautiful and luxurious. The concierge was excellent and assisted us in booking all our tickets and explained the location of the various tourist sites with patience. The hotel is definitely expensive b ut well worth it. It is right next to Champs Elysees yet it is tucked into a street (Rue Balzac) so it is less noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Balzac-No merci”
Reviews.Author: busterboybay
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the most worst hotels in Paris. The location is on busy cross streets, the service is non existent, furnishings are tattered and bathrooms are a joke. During our stay, they ran out of booze, lost power all night and had no food service. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Really romantic stay”
Reviews.Author: HotelEnthusiast09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really romantic and incredibly Parisian. Our room was really pretty, on the small side (par for the course in expensive capital cities) but not at all pokey, with a tiny balcony with a view of the Eiffel Tower over rooftops. It was absolutely lovely and the macaroons and pastries laid out in welcome were delicious. The rooms are not about minimalist chic but it was great fun to bed down in someplace so unabashedly romantic - all opulent fabrics and textures and patterns in shades of reds, maroons, pinks and gold. The shower was fantastic (rainhead) and we enjoyed being able to have after-dinner drinks in the bar with no pressure to drink up even though the bar was closing. The staff were fine for us to stay as long as we wanted even after they'd finished for the day; we chose instead to take our glasses up to our room and finished them on the balcony enjoying the fantastic view. The staff are really helpful and pleasant and the location is fantastic. Overall well worth a splurge.

Reviews.Title: “A Rare Find!”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaMarbella_Spain
Reviews.Content: Who would believe that less than 1 minute's walk from The Champs Elysee one would find such a treasure as Hotel Balzac. From the moment you arrive, you are made to feel like the most special guest there. The welcome is like none we have received before. Although we arrived directly from the airport an hour before check-in time, we only had to wait 10 minutes for our room, giving us the opportunity to speak to the excellent Concierge, Michele. Whatever you need to know about Paris, he can help you with. He recommeded the most wonderful bistro for our first night in Paris. Our room was charming and beautifully decorated with luxurious jewel coloured fabrics. At all times during our stay, every member of staff was friendly, polite, helpful and professional. There is a very grand and luxurious feel about this beautiful boutique hotel, yet you instantly feel comfortable and at ease. The sort of hotel you hope to find in Paris - and definetly one to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a great Location”
Reviews.Author: shopku
Reviews.Content: Hotel Balzac was the perfect hotel for my 3rd trip to Paris with my mom. We requested a room with a view and got room 406 which was a picture perfect room. We arrived early in the morning and our room was ready for us to check into. When we entered the room we were amazed at how beautiful the decor was and how big the room was. We stayed in the Junior Suite which had a separate sitting area, a dining room table, a rain shower and separate bath tub, a King Size bed and a wrap around balcony that had a view of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is just 2 minutes off the Champs and closest to the George V metro and the Charles De Gaulle metro station. Inside our hotel room when we arrived was a bottle of Champagne, strawberries and cookies. A great suprise after a long day of traveling. The hotel staff was very nice and tried their best to help us get around as there was a bit of a language barrier with some of the staff members. The continental breakfast is an assortment of breads, coffee, juices and tea. We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning since it was included in the rate. If its not included I would go elsewhere for breakfast. I found the best rate for this hotel by using their 1-800 number and calling the hotel directly. I spoke with a lady named Claire who gave us a great rate and The perfect room. Overall, the hotel was safe, clean and in a great location. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location & very very French”
Reviews.Author: cynmar61
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Balzac twice now 1988 & 2008 which also is the only 2 times I have been to Paris.. Reason I returned after 20 years, this time with my wife, was the unbelievable memory I had of this magnificent hotel just off the Champs Elysee with views of the Eiffel Tower and 2 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe. We were not disappointed and it really was a highlight of our romantic stay in Paris. Room was beautiful and for Paris not overly small.. A lovely small balcony which you could see the Eiffel Tower from and the furnishings in the room were just perfect and made you feel very much in the French mood. This is a pricey hotel, altho Paris is just an expensive city but we managed to get a discounted price and very much worth keeping an eye out for the specials as this is a highly recommended hotel.. Don't buy a drink in the lobby bar. the cost is unbelievably high and why spend it there when you have bars and cafes absolutely everywhere surrounding you. The location can not be beat

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location & Rooms, But Uneven Service”
Reviews.Author: amlboston
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic, just one block away from the stretch of the Champs Elysee very close to the Arc de Triomphe. The rooms are clean, recently renovated, and beautifully decorated. The only bad thing about this hotel is their service. Some of their staff speak English fluently while others at the front desk can barely understand English. We asked the Concierge to recommend a good Japanese restaurant (we were ready for a break from French after four straight days of full-course meals) and his recommendation was Chinese. It was a good thing the restaurant was listed in our Fodors guide and we did not actually go to it. We booked three rooms through American Express travel. The rooms were prepaid, but upon checkout, the hotel staff tried to make us pay the bill a second time and only after much hassle did we get everything straightened out. Also, they had minibar charges for all of the rooms that were clearly not ours; the charges were dropped from our bill but I think a hotel of this caliber really should not have these issues. Not only that but on the day we checked in, our minibar had a bottle of water that was already open and half empty. I think the hotel stay was mostly enjoyable, but the service in the hotel does not meet the standards of a fine boutique hotel of this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Hen-nyTN
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Balzac's location is wonderful, and the rooms are beautifully decorated. If only the service was as good as the physical surroundings. With the exception of the excellent concierge staff, we found staff members difficult to find and very unresponsive to a number of problems. Housekeeping was very late and there was no turn-down service unless we specifically requested it. The temperature in our room was unbearably hot unless we opened the window to the street noise. Internet service, for which we paid an astonishing Euro 22 per day, was intermittent. On the other hand, room service breakfast was beautifully served and very prompt. Our room was tiny and did not have a view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Balzac”
Reviews.Author: travelier2910
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. From the minute we walked in we were welcomed. Everyone was so gracious. We checked in very early but our room wouldn't be ready until the afternoon (which is pretty standard) so we left our things with the front desk and explored the city. When we returned, the front desk clerk showed us directly to our room. When we entered our room it was wonderful, we were both amazed. The room was so spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was even great. We had a bathtub and a seperate rain shower. The commode was even high tech. It had a little control panel to the left that would clean your front, back and then air dry the area. Another thing, was that the concierge was so helpful and kind. We couldn't have gotten everywhere we wanted to go without him. He told us the ins and outs of the city. I can not say enough good things about this hotel. It was beautiful. As far as location, the location was wonderful. It was one block from the Champs Elysee and then one block from Arc de Triomph. It is also a short 10-15 walk to great shopping on the Avenue Montaigne. This is where you find shops like Chloe, Louis Vuitton, Chanel, Hotel Athenee, Dior and many others. We just walked everywhere. You are also close to the subway that will take you straight to the Louvre. The Location was great. We loved this hotel. We would surely stay here again in the future and recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Carl-Peter1969
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to celebrate our wedding anniversary in Paris and choose to stay at this beautiful boutique hotel. The location is more than perfect, 1 minute walk to the Champs Elysée. The hotel is does comply with all services as one may expect from a 4-star hotel in Paris, great and friendly service, beautiful rooms, a big bathroom (special mention to the special toilet and bathtub highlights...). Our room had a direct view at the Eiffel Tower. Breakfast is up to standard, served at the lobby. The concierge helped us with a restaurant reservation but first he recommended the hotel's own restaurant, you do not see that so often......in overall, a great hotel and absolutely recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lee10
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel in great central location. Room very small but fantastic view of Eiffel Tower. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous”
Reviews.Author: DATP
Reviews.Content: What a gem, what a hotel!! We booked a celebratory stay as it was my husband's 60th birthday and we were dining at Pierre Gagnaire (3rd best restaurant in the world in the same building as the hotel). It was a special 3 days and the hotel more than matched our expectations. The room was beautiful with a view across the rooftops to the Eiffel Tower; the bed very comfortable and the bathroom extremely well-appointed. Everything had been thought of - roses, champagne and a box of rose-flavoured maccaroons provided. The staff were attentive and friendly but not obsequious. The breakfast was excellent - a large well-stocked buffet. i would thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off breakfast, beautiful decor”
Reviews.Author: biztraveller58
Reviews.Content: Hotel is wonderfully decorated, and despite its central location and proximity to the Arc de Triomphe, very quiet. Very comfortable bed, nice variett of pillows. Single rooms have VERY small bathrooms, with shower cabinets too small for the very large rain-head shower in it. My main negatives on this hotel were down to service - breakfast wasnt ready in the lounge at the time it should have been, and then very slow. Lounge still being cleaned at that time as well. Biggest issue was over breakfast charge - despite my rate including breakfast, they tried to charge 38 eur for it. Rationale was: only continental breakfast was included. I was not informed of that in advance, nor was it clear that continental did not include ham. No cooked breakfast was offered to me, as they were not ready. This charge was eventually removed but the attitude and surliness of the receptionist was very unwelcome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: basrock1
Reviews.Content: First- you cannot beat the location! Literally a block off the Champs-Elysees and a 2- minute walk to a metro station. This is a luxury boutique hotel, Parisian-style. Rooms are decent size for European standards. Bathrooms are SO cool- the toilet has a heater, a dryer and a bidet all rolled up into one! I found the service to be excellent... on my 2nd night there, I fell very ill with a stomach virus and we had to cancel our tickets to the Moulin Rouge. The concierge was so nice- he called up twice just to make sure I was okay, to see if I needed anything, and to ask if I needed a doctor. I thought that was outstanding. The next morning, it seemed as though the entire hotel knew I hadn't been feeling well, I was doted on. Breakfast room in the morning was lovely with plenty variety and good service. Prices can be a little high for the room rates, but I think it's worth it for the location and the service and the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Complete perfection”
Reviews.Author: mck9982
Reviews.Content: I planned a romantic European trip with my girlfriend and after looking into hundred's of hotels over the web and reading tons of reviews I decided on the Hotel Balzac. I can not tell how happy I am that I did. We stayed here from July 10th -14th, 2008 and both fell in love with the hotel and staff. This was the first leg of a 3 city European tour and our stay at the Hotel Balzac was by far the best hotel of the whole trip. Everything from the perfect location to the beautiful lobby was stunning. We were greated right away and felt instantly as if the staff knew us. The staff was so helpful and helped us for everything to cabs to a dinner reservation (which was by far the best and most romantic restaurant we ate at on the trip). These guys truly were the best and made our stay so much more enjoyable because of it. I had also requested a room with an Effiel tower view and was so happy to get our room with a direct view of the Effiel tower - ait's wesome at night. The hotel bills itself as the most romantic hotel in Paris and it totally seems to be. It had a charm and an air of romance that could be felt immediatly from the incredible huge fresh flowers in the lobby and restaurant to the cool purple and red colors that dominate through out the hotel. Oh and talk about service - I ordered some roses and champage to be placed in the room before we arrived and they provided 3 dozen of the freshest roses. The details were incredible! We loved this place and hope to stay there again. Thank you Hotel Balzac for making our stay so enjoyable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBob
Reviews.Content: The two of us stayed here for a few nights in April 2008. First the good points: * the location is perfect, a one minute walk to the middle of the champs elysee. * we had a large room with a view of the eiffel tower. The nighttime light show on the tower is spectacular. * the room was big and well furnished * we got a reservation to pierre gagnaire and it was sensational. now the bad points: * the staff seem to have a fetish for entering your room even when the do not disturb sign is on the door. On at least 3 occassions that we returned to our room there was a staff member in the room!!!! Not a cleaner but someone just standing there!!!! other times we would be in the room and they would just barge in without even knocking and then see us and leave without talking. Very strange!!! I rang the front desk once to check that one of the people was actually a member of staff. * The rooms should be equipped with an iron and ironing board. I know lots of places in france (for whatever reason) do not have them in the room but when you are catering for an overseas market they are essential * Be careful about breakfast. Continental breakfast was included in our rate which normally includes juice, coffee, cereal and fruit and normally does not include hot food, meats or cheeses. Well one morning as we were leaving we were told that we had to sign the bill for the "buffett breakfast" We said we did not have any hot food, well the staff member quite rudely told us that he watched us have fruit and yoghurt and that is not included in the continental breakfast. Well if that is the way the Hotel runs their breakfast that is fine but they should have explained what was and wasn't included. Would we stay here again? Probably not. It was a good stay rather than a bad stay or a great stay but with so many Hotels in Paris we would look probably look elsewhere. I would suggest this Hotel however for the first time visitor to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: david_k001
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at Balzac on New Years Day and the doorman addressed us by name as he helped us out of the taxi. Either he has ESP or we were the final late arrival of the day. I suspect the latter, but it was still a nice touch. The gentleman that checked us in was very gracious and showed us to our room. It was a nicely decorated. A mix of traditional and contemporary touches. Being that it was New Years, there was a bottle of chilled champagne in a bucket and chocolates waiting for us when we entered. Another nice touch. The room was very comfortable and I got a kick out of the Toto toilet seat that washes and dries. If you like gadgets and haven't seen this before, you'll get a chuckle out of it. Hotel B was definitely comfortable and offers a bit of luxury, but I think there are comparable hotels in Paris that aren't as expensive. However, if you need to be in that part of town, Hotel B is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Such a sweet stay.”
Reviews.Author: acuffrose
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Balzac is beautiful-- perfectly Parisian, wonderfully located and genuinely high-class. All staff were very attentive and helpful-- we were with three young (very well behaved) children but were never made to feel like a nuisance. And housekeeping even noticed that we were using all the Molton Brown hand lotion, because on the third day, a larger bottle replaced the tiny hotel-sized one. The rooms are (slightly) larger than other hotels I've stayed in in Paris, so you can open your suitcase without having to set it on the bed. The food was good, although I definitely recommend taking their advice on restaurants to visit. The breakfast, however, is fantastic. Fresh breads and an excellent fruit selection (very impressive in the middle of December!) was a great way to begin the day. And you are literally 2 blocks off the Champs Elysees. And there's a bike-share rack on the second of those blocks. It's all but impossible to beat the location. A couple of cons: the heat wasn't working in our room and it took 2 days to fix (it was -4 celsius), so we had to make do with a space heater (it worked okay, but still), and the menu could be better. But overall, I definitely recommend the Hotel Balzac.

Reviews.Title: “'Excellent Hotel', fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: DPB2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Balzac for three nights and our overall experience was a pleasant one. upon arrival, the hotel staff rushed out and took all our luggage from us which was really nice.At check in we was told that our room was not ready which was a bit disappointing, however we did get there slightly before the check in time and the staff offered to take my mobile number and call when the room was ready. I received a call within thirty minutes. The room was lovely and had no complaints, we had booked a Superior-Double however it appeared we were upgraded to a Deluxe Double as we had a balcony and a truely fantastic view of the Eiffel tower. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was fully air conditioned, in addition to this there was also a mini bar, which was regularly replenished. The hotel staff were very friendly and most spoke good english. They all went out their way to assist us and accomodate our requirements, and the prompt response we received was very good. The only problem we encountered was the quality of the food that was bought up to our room. The food was quite expensive, which you would expect from a luxury hotel however my dish was nearly cold and my girlfriend's dish contained eggs which it clearly shouldn't have. Therefore we was not impressed with the food. Putting the food issue aside, I would recommend this hotel to anyone as it is a really nice place. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good for mini break”
Reviews.Author: lou9685
Reviews.Content: booked the hotel through lastminute and there was a free upbgrade to a superior deluxe room. The room was lovely, no complaints, you could see the hotel has been recently revamped....only problem was, there were touches that you could tell didn't make it a superior hotel, little things like there was no switch next to the bed for the light on one side of the bed, little things, but if you are paying to stay in a top rated hotel, then you notice thinks like that! apart from that, the whole experience was lovely....rooms were quiet nice views, even over the atruim. didn't eat in the hotel, but there was only a very small bar which felt a bit too 'quiet' to sit in. staff were friendly and helpful - would stay there again on a weekend break

Reviews.Title: “Arab orientated hotel, serious accomodation flaws”
Reviews.Author: DavidBelgium
Reviews.Content: The Balzac is a rather small and beautiful hotel, although there are some serious accomodation flaws. The room (deluxe room) was nicely decorated but small. The twin rooms don't really have two separated beds (see picture). A serious accomodation flaw is the bar of the hotel. It's supposed to be open until midnight, but at 23:30 everything was already set for breakfast and the bar was closed. The bar is very small and is also used for breakfast (they don't have a restaurant or other room for breakfast). The small bar has four little bistro tables and two sofa's (see picture). So if you're not having breakfast in your room, expect a 'laptop-style' breakfast in a sofa. Breakfast in the room was very poor for the price. It's obvious that this hotel is more leaning towards arab clients. 80% of the guestbook is signed in arabic. Two different arabic papers but not one french in the lobby. The location is good, but due to the small room and very limited other accomodations in the hotel, it's certainly wasn't worth the 430 euro/night. For that price there are without any doubt better locations in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Reopening is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: videokenomom
Reviews.Content: Words cannot express our enjoyment of this fine, luxurious boutique hotel. Reopened in mid-July, we arrived here on July 28th and will leave, sadly, on August 3rd. This is THE PLACE to stay if you are looking for romance or a convenient location to the Champs-elysees. One short block - at Rue de Balzac, will lead you to all of the sights and sounds of the avenue near the Arc de Triumphe. 1 short block from the George V metro. This gorgeous hotel starts your stay off with a greeting and offer of beverage and treats (including macaroons from Lauduree), while awaiting the check-in. Personnel personally escort you and show all of the features available in your room. We took advantage of a special offer, booking a junior suite and getting upgraded to the one bedroom suite. It is to die for! The first room includes a honor mini-bar (which isn't cheap) leading into the living room. Decorated in purple, green and french white, it includes a very comfortable sofa, chair, chandelier, gorgeous silver and glass lamps as well as a flat screen TV. The bathroom offers a stand alone shower with rain shower head, a bathtub with and-held shower spray, a beautiful ornate silver and marble sink and a toilet that also acts as a bidet. It even offers a first for us - a warm toilet seat!!!! It was a little too funny when we first sat on it. Toiletries are offered by Molten Brown. The adjoining bedroom contains a real king bed, two end tables, writing desk and a huge closet. Strangely there is no dresser but we're making do with the drawers in the bedside tables. A safe is also available as well as slippers, bathrooms, shoe protectors and hair dryer. A very small balcony is offered in both the living room and bedroom. No view unless you are on the top floor. The airconditioning works great. We were treated wonderfully so far with a welcome tray of chocolates and macaroons from Laduree and La Maison de Chocolate. Also received a bottle of champagne and fresh fruit. Room service feels like it is literally minutes from response and that's probably because there are only about 70 rooms in the hotel. There is a small dining area but we haven't enjoyed the offerings yet. The only negatives if I were to find them, are the lack of a shelf in the shower for toiletries, hardly any television shows (including old movies on the pay-per-view), no drawers for stowing some items - but really no problems to speak of. There is no doubt that we will always return to this hotel. In some respects we feel out of our league among the clientele but I wouldn't trade what is offered for any other hotel. I loved the convenience, decorated rooms and the comfort in knowing things are taken care of. For those with physical problems, they had a luggage life to bring the luggage off the street into the hotel and I noticed that it is also used for strollers and wheelchairs. There is also an elevator and air conditioning. Turn down service, complete with yet more chocolates, is available. Some of the other services included such things as special cleaning services for your couture items, a butler, concierge services and parking. Decadent? Perhaps, but it is being marketed as one of the small luxury hotels in the world and for a once-in-a-lifetime experience, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone. I'll upload photos when we return.

Reviews.Title: “old style very elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel had the old worlc feel. Very nice, family friendly. Beautiful breakfast. atmosphere was wonderful. You could sit for hours. Rooms were very comfortable and what a beautiful bathroom. I will stay there again. So close to Champls Elysee.
